Inducing Causes of Immorality. 
Diet. 
     927. If ever there was a time that the diet should be of the most simple kind, it is now. Meat should not be placed before our children. Its influence is to excite and strengthen the lower passions, and has a tendency to deaden the moral powers. . . . The less feverish the diet, the more easily can the passions be controlled.-- T., V. II, p. 352.
